questions.question: The boy ..................................... for stealing.
questions.description: The boy did not punish he was punished (by somebody else). With the other options, an object would be required to make the sentence complete.

questions.question: I ............................... him for several years.
questions.description: We normally use perfect tenses with the time expressions since and for.

questions.question: ...................................... he continue to be unpunctual, he shall be dismissed.
questions.description: 'Should he continue' here means 'if he continues'.

questions.question: Had he told me earlier, I ...................................... arranged it.
questions.description: The given sentence is in the third conditional. Here we use would have + past participle in the main clause.

questions.question: If that man had drank less, he .................................... developed heart trouble.
questions.description: The given sentence is in the third conditional. Here we use would have + past participle in the main clause.

questions.question: The minister .......................................... the foundation stone of the school.
questions.description: Lied is simple past tense and past participle of lie. Laid is the second form of lay (to keep).

questions.question: All the expenses .................................... by the company.
questions.description: 'By' indicates passive voice. 'Was/were + third form of the verb' is used in the passive voice of simple past tense. 'Expenses' is plural and hence we use 'were' here.

questions.question: Whenever he is in Mumbai, my father ..................................... with us.
questions.description: 'Whenever' indicates a routine. We use the present simple to talk about habits and routines.

questions.question: When I visited him, he ...................................... bedridden for two months.
questions.description: The past perfect continuous is used to talk about an action that started in the past and continued up to later moment in the past.

questions.question: I will call you when dinner ......................................... ready.
questions.description: When the verb in the main clause is in the future tense, we use a present tense in the subordinate clause to indicate future.

questions.question: The war ........................................ for two years, when John enlisted.
questions.description: The past perfect continuous is used to talk about an action that started in the past and continued up to later moment in the past.

questions.question: ............................................ the message, the man departed.
questions.description: The man departed after he had given the message. This is best expressed by the use of the phrase 'having given'.
